article:
'VÃ¡zquez' (or 'VÃ¡squez', 'VÃ¡sques', 'Vasquez') is an original Galician surname,
in use not only in Galicia but all over Spanish-speaking (and, at a lesser
extent, Portuguese-speaking, where Vasco as surname predominates) countries.
Vasquez means "[son] of Vasco" and Vasco comes from the pre-Roman latinized name
"Velascus" (of uncertain origin and meaning, probably Basque or Iberian), which
evolves in Galician-Portuguese Velascu > Veascu > Vaasco > Vasco (Sp.cognate
Velasco, surname VelÃ¡zquez). Ferreiro, M. GramÃ¡tica HistÃ³rica Galega, pp.84,
ISBN 84-87847-68-4
